Shuowen Jiezi states, "Bo means a horse of impure color." Southwestern Short-legs with mixed, inconsistent coloring are called Chibo.\nHuayang Chorography, Records of the Southern Regions, notes, "Elders say a divine steed once emerges from Dianchi Lake. When bred, it sires swift horses, known as'Dianchi Foals', said to run five hundred Li a day." During the Tang and Song Dynasties, the Records of the Man People further records, "Horses come from the eastern foot of Mount Yuetan… high-tailed and swift, they run hundreds of Li daily… Tengchong and Shendan also produce horses, second to Yuetan, with Dianchi being the finest." The New Book of Tang, Biography of Nanzhao Clan, likewise says, "West of Yuetan lies lush grass, where fine horses are bred, known as the 'Yuetan Steeds.' Born like lambs, raised on fine grass and rice water, they are rideable by seven years and run hundreds of Li per day." These Dian Horses, so named for their origin near Dianchi Lake, are the Southwestern Pony.\nSmall in stature, with fine limbs, short necks, broad foreheads, and firm, compact hooves, Southwestern Ponies are prized for endurance. Suited for riding, dragging, or carrying loads, they are the most common breed in the southwest.

To adjudicate a dispute, one must trace its origins to weigh intent and assign blame. Gao Qing accuses Li Er of stealing a jade bracelet belonging to his wife. One morning, Madam Gao noticed the bracelet missing from her wrist. She testified that she had fallen asleep during the fourth watch and awoke shortly after, never removing the bracelet nor hearing any disturbance. Suspecting Li Er, Gao Qing led servants to search his home and allegedly recovered the stolen item.
Li Er's testimony reveals that he is Gao Qing's tenant, farming nine mu of poor-quality land. After crop failures from floods and droughts, he fell behind on rent. His sole possession was a jade bracelet, his late wife's dowry, which Gao Qing seized as collateral. However, Li Er claims the bracelet was not stolen by him but by a Swordsman who overheard his lamentations. This man, known only by the alias "Meridian Touch," stole the bracelet that very night but returned it to Li Er, urging him to hide it well. Yet Gao Qing found it anyway.
Of Meridian Touch, I have heard. The yamen has several unsolved cases involving him. Li Er, a lifelong farmer, is physically frail and lacks the agility for rooftop theft. Moreover, Gao Qing's compound shows no signs of forced entry. Thus, Gao Qing's accusation lacks solid evidence.  
However, Li Er accepted the bracelet as debt payment, knew of the impending theft, and failed to intervene. Though not guilty of theft, he harbored stolen goods. Considering his clean record, he is spared theft charges but sentenced to twenty strokes. The bracelet is returned to Gao Qing. A warrant is issued for Meridian Touch; upon capture, his cases will be consolidated for further judgment.

Special combat rules apply in the 1v1 Arena mode. 

Using Deflect consumes Endurance, while finishing Execute restores Endurance. 

Most player skills can be deflected. Defense-breaking Mystic Arts not only ignore deflect but also deal enhanced effects when hitting targets who are defending or deflecting. However, these Mystic Arts can be interrupted by any skill. 

Player skills, including Mystic Arts and Charged Skill, can interrupt Light and Heavy Attacks, but not vice versa. 

Effective use of Control-breaking Skills can turn the tide. 

Defeating your rival grants 1v1 Arena Points. Heroes with the higher points will enter the Arena Leaderboard. 

In 1v1 Arena, player Healing effects are reduced by 90%; Damage to targets' HP Shields is increased by 100%.

Since taking over Mercyheart Monastery, Huiyao has allied with all manner of outlaws. These people joined the monastery under the guise of monks, but in reality, they lived as bandits and called themselves "ascetic monks." Huimiao stood out among them for being a womanizer and even went by the nickname "Yab-Yum." As the fourth-in-command, he guards Bloomveil Monastery, where he and his men would go around abducting young women from nearby villages... Just recently, another group of village girls was taken. Word has it that inside the temple, Huimiao tries to talk them into "practicing Buddhism" with him—obviously with bad intentions. Time to rescue those innocent women! When not engaged in combat, you can enter through the main gate with the gift of gab as #Ya scholar#E and use your silver tongue to talk Huimiao down. #Y(Recommended Scholar Mastery: 1500)#E

Dear Wanderer,
The seasons turn, and a new year is upon us.
Velvet Shade is preparing a Fireworks Festival for the celebration, held nightly from New Year's Eve to the fifth day, beginning at 19:30. I wonder, would you be willing to grace our festivities with your presence? Come see the sky filled with fireworks, and if you wish, take a look at the person standing by your side.
Naturally, Velvet Shade would not have you come for nothing. We have prepared Red Envelopes and are waiting for you by Pearlglow Lake in Online Mode.
Remember now, don't go to the wrong place tomorrow. Don't let the fireworks, the red envelopes, and me all wait for nothing.
The bundle! Has my brother taken the bundle away?

His descendants upheld this vision, ultimately creating the Art of Wandering Clouds.

All vessels follow the flesh; all sinews follow the bones. The body contains 365 bones, bound and interwoven in structure. By them, the hands can grasp, the feet can walk—every motion flows from their alignment. But in sudden calamities—falls, crashes, violent twists—injuries may occur beyond prediction. In treatment, minor cases call for reducing swelling and easing spasms, while serious ones require reconnecting sinews and resetting bones. For each, there are time-tested prescriptions.

Participate in the 5v5 Arena to make friends through martial arts. In this 5v5 competitive mode, players can form teams of five to engage in strategic battles.
5v5 Arena entry is available from @T[time_19:45] to @T[time_20]. Be sure to join in on time. Once the match begins, up to four teams with similar ranking points will be grouped into a round-robin bracket. Each group will play three matches, with each match using a best-of-three format. Teams that win a match will earn Season Points and Engagement tokens.

In this mode, healing effects are reduced by 70%. After a certain time in battle, players will deal increased damage while healing effectiveness is further reduced. Using the "Deflection" skill consumes Endurance, but successfully executing a finisher restores it.

Most player skills can be countered using "Deflection." However, Armor-Piercing Mystic Skills can't be blocked this way and are especially effective against defensive targets or those using "Deflection"—though they can be interrupted by any skill.

Various player skills (including Mystic Arts and Charged Skills) can interrupt light and heavy attacks, but not the other way around.

Mastering crowd-control removal skills can turn the tide of battle when at a disadvantage.

The side that defeats all players of the other first within the time limit wins. If the timer runs out without a decisive outcome, the winner is determined by the following priorities: 1. The side with more surviving players wins; 2. If the number of surviving players is equal, the side with the higher total damage dealt wins; 3. If the total damage dealt is equal, the side with the higher total healing amount wins.

"From the Yellow River in the west to the Huai River in the east, a lush green expanse stretches for miles."

Shadow Play Act 1

Father: "We were blessed with twin sons, but fate is cruel! The elder is weak and sickly, the younger is mute. Both have flaws. After much deliberation, we have to abandon the elder."

Younger Son: (enters stage) "Where are Mother, Father, and Brother going? Let me follow and see."



Shadow Play Act 2

(Narrator): The three journey up the mountain, with the youngest following.

Mother: "My heart is cut by knives! Tears fall as I leave my child. If not for poverty, why must we come to this?"

Elder Son: "My parents abandoned me in the mountains. Curse this weak body! Now I fear for my life."

Younger Son: "How heartless my parents are! We are twins. How can I live alone?"



Shadow Play Act 3

(Narrator): "There were once twin brothers. Their parents abandoned the elder one in the mountains, not knowing that the younger one followed. When the parents returned home, both sons were gone. The twin brothers supported each other and emerged from the mountains. Though their lives were full of hardships, they became famous after overcoming trials. They bravely resisted the Khitan invaders and became heroes for their country and people!"

Special combat rules apply in the 1v1 Arena mode. 

Using Deflect consumes Endurance, while finishing Execute restores Endurance. 

Most player skills can be deflected. Defense-breaking Mystic Arts not only ignore deflect but also deal enhanced effects when hitting targets who are defending or deflecting. However, these Mystic Arts can be interrupted by any skill. 

Player skills, including Mystic Arts and Charged Skill, can interrupt Light and Heavy Attacks, but not vice versa. 

Effective use of Control-breaking Skills can turn the tide. 

Defeating your rival grants 1v1 Arena Points. Heroes with the higher points will enter the Arena Leaderboard. 

In 1v1 Arena, player Healing effects are reduced by 90%; Damage to targets' HP Shields is increased by 100%.

In 1v1 Arena, the maximum increase percentage for the untargetable duration of Dodge is capped at 20%.

The side that defeats the other first within the time limit wins. If the timer runs out without a decisive outcome, the winner is determined by the following priorities:
1. The side with more surviving players wins;
2. If the number of surviving players is equal, the side with the higher total damage dealt wins;
3. If the total damage dealt is equal, the side with the higher total healing amount wins.

On that day in 946, when Liu Xian returned to the house with the sign "Zhang's Eatery" over the door, the lights were still on inside. She touched the scar on her arm. The skin there was wrinkled and puckered.
Her father had lost money gambling, come home drunk, and smashed a lamp on her. That's how she got the scar.
From the very first scar, she learned: if she came home from her odd jobs and saw the lamp still burning, it meant her father had been drinking and had already collapsed somewhere inside.
She was already skinny, and she'd scrunch herself up as small as possible when she walked in, looking as shriveled and fragile as the burn on her arm.
She would step as lightly as she could, lighter and lighter, until her footsteps were as weightless as her whole existence: barely there, easily overlooked.
She was always on guard, careful not to wake her father, and too scared to even look his way. So she would creep through the house, eyes locked on that lamp. If the flame so much as flickered, she'd freeze, bracing herself as if she'd been burned, not daring to move again until everything was completely silent. Then, she'd inch herself into the farthest, darkest corner from the lamp, praying for dawn, praying that when morning came, he still wouldn't wake.
She wasn't like her mother. Her mother had run away when she had only five scars; Liu Xian couldn't run.
She was just a seven-year-old girl. Inside the house or out, the world felt like a burning lamp she was terrified to touch.
She was still thinking about all this, pacing outside, when her footsteps must have caught someone's attention. The man she'd seen the day before, Zhang Ankang, came to the door with a lantern. She quickly hid the food she'd stolen and took a step back.
"Why don't you come inside?"
He looked like a good man, but she'd learned there were plenty of people who looked good, enough to make room for plenty of bad ones, too.
Inside, at the same old table under the same old lamp, was a bowl of steaming noodles.
She stared at it blankly. "What is this?"
Her confusion was reflected on his face. "Noodles, but there's just one bowl left. How about we share?"
For him, offering food to someone or waiting for someone to eat seemed as natural as breathing. For her, in this world, it felt as impossible as killing or being killed.
Liu Xian thought that, before this war, he must have lived a good life, to still be able to be a good person.
